title: Tolcapone (Oral Route)
text:
【0】Tolcapone (Oral Route)
Description and Brand Names
---------------------------

【1】Drug information provided by: Merative, Micromedex®

【2】### US Brand Name

【3】1.  Tasmar

【4】### Descriptions

【5】Tolcapone is used in combination with levodopa and carbidopa for the treatment of the symptoms of Parkinson's disease.

【6】This medicine is available only with your doctor's prescription.

【7】This product is available in the following dosage forms:

【8】*   Tablet

【9】Before Using
------------

【10】In deciding to use a medicine, the risks of taking the medicine must be weighed against the good it will do. This is a decision you and your doctor will make. For this medicine, the following should be considered:

【11】### Allergies

【12】Tell your doctor if you have ever had any unusual or allergic reaction to this medicine or any other medicines. Also tell your health care professional if you have any other types of allergies, such as to foods, dyes, preservatives, or animals. For non-prescription products, read the label or package ingredients carefully.

【13】### Pediatric

【14】Studies on this medicine have been done only in adult patients. There is no identified potential use of tolcapone in children.

【15】### Geriatric

【16】The risk of hallucinations (seeing, hearing, or feeling things that are not there) may be increased in patients older than 75 years of age.

【17】### Breastfeeding

【18】There are no adequate studies in women for determining infant risk when using this medication during breastfeeding. Weigh the potential benefits against the potential risks before taking this medication while breastfeeding.

【19】### Drug Interactions

【20】Although certain medicines should not be used together at all, in other cases two different medicines may be used together even if an interaction might occur. In these cases, your doctor may want to change the dose, or other precautions may be necessary. When you are taking this medicine, it is especially important that your healthcare professional know if you are taking any of the medicines listed below. The following interactions have been selected on the basis of their potential significance and are not necessarily all-inclusive.

【21】Using this medicine with any of the following medicines is usually not recommended, but may be required in some cases. If both medicines are prescribed together, your doctor may change the dose or how often you use one or both of the medicines.

【22】*   Iproniazid
*   Isocarboxazid
*   Linezolid
*   Methotrexate
*   Nialamide
*   Pargyline
*   Pexidartinib
*   Phenelzine
*   Procarbazine
*   Tranylcypromine

【23】### Other Interactions

【24】Certain medicines should not be used at or around the time of eating food or eating certain types of food since interactions may occur. Using alcohol or tobacco with certain medicines may also cause interactions to occur. Discuss with your healthcare professional the use of your medicine with food, alcohol, or tobacco.

【25】### Other Medical Problems

【26】The presence of other medical problems may affect the use of this medicine. Make sure you tell your doctor if you have any other medical problems, especially:

【27】*   Hallucinations (seeing, hearing, or feeling things that are not there)—Condition may become worse.

【28】*   High fever and confusion or
*   Muscle injury, aches, cramps—You should not take tolcapone.

【29】*   Kidney problems, severe—Elimination of tolcapone may be decreased, which increases the risk of unwanted effects.

【30】*   Liver problems or
*   Liver tests higher than normal—This medicine can increase chances of serious liver problems. You should not start taking this medicine if you have these problems.

【31】*   Low blood pressure or
*   Orthostatic or postural low blood pressure (dizziness or lightheadedness when getting up suddenly from a sitting or lying position)—Condition may become worse.

【32】Proper Use
----------

【33】Take this medicine only as directed by your doctor, to help your condition as much as possible. Do not take more or less of it, and do not take it more or less often than your doctor ordered.

【34】It is important that you and your doctor discuss the risks of this medicine and that you read and sign a written informed consent before you begin taking this medicine.

【35】### Dosing

【36】The dose of this medicine will be different for different patients. Follow your doctor's orders or the directions on the label. The following information includes only the average doses of this medicine. If your dose is different, do not change it unless your doctor tells you to do so.

【37】The amount of medicine that you take depends on the strength of the medicine. Also, the number of doses you take each day, the time allowed between doses, and the length of time you take the medicine depend on the medical problem for which you are using the medicine.

【38】*   For oral dosage form (tablets):
    *   For Parkinson's disease:
        *   Adults—100 milligrams (mg) three times a day, taken in addition to levodopa and carbidopa.
        *   Children—Use and dose must be determined by your doctor.

【39】### Missed Dose

【40】If you miss a dose of this medicine, take it as soon as possible. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and go back to your regular dosing schedule. Do not double doses.

【41】### Storage

【42】Store the medicine in a closed container at room temperature, away from heat, moisture, and direct light. Keep from freezing.

【43】Keep out of the reach of children.

【44】Do not keep outdated medicine or medicine no longer needed.

【45】Precautions
-----------

【46】It is important that your doctor check your progress at regular visits. Tolcapone may have serious effects on your liver. You must have regular blood tests done to make sure this medicine is not affecting your liver.

【47】Because tolcapone may have serious effects on your liver, you should watch for any signs of these effects. Signs include dark urine; itching; light-colored stools; loss of appetite; nausea (continuing); tenderness in upper right part of abdomen; unusual drowsiness, dullness, or feeling sluggish; unusual tiredness or weakness; or yellow eyes or skin. If you notice any of these signs, contact your doctor.

【48】Do not stop taking tolcapone without first checking with your doctor. Your doctor may want you to gradually reduce the amount you are taking before stopping completely.

【49】Tolcapone may cause dizziness or lightheadedness, drowsiness, weakness, or trouble in thinking or concentrating. Make sure you know how you react to this medicine before you drive, use machines, or do anything else that could be dangerous if you are not alert, well-coordinated, or able to think clearly.

【50】Dizziness, lightheadedness, or fainting may occur, especially when you get up from a lying or sitting position. Getting up slowly may help. If you should have this problem, check with your doctor.

【51】Hallucinations (seeing, hearing, or feeling things that are not there) may occur in some patients. This is more common in elderly patients.

【52】You may experience nausea, especially when you first begin taking this medicine.

【53】Tolcapone causes the urine to turn bright yellow. This is to be expected while you are taking it. This effect is harmless and will go away after you stop taking the medicine.

【54】Side Effects
------------

【55】Along with its needed effects, a medicine may cause some unwanted effects. Although not all of these side effects may occur, if they do occur they may need medical attention.

【56】Check with your doctor immediately if any of the following side effects occur:

【57】#### Incidence not known

【58】1.  Dark urine
2.  itching
3.  light-colored stools
4.  loss of appetite
5.  nausea (continuing)
6.  tenderness in upper right part of abdomen
7.  unusual drowsiness, dullness, or feeling sluggish
8.  unusual tiredness or weakness
9.  yellow eyes or skin

【59】Check with your doctor as soon as possible if any of the following side effects occur:

【60】#### More common

【61】1.  Abdominal pain
2.  cough
3.  diarrhea
4.  dizziness
5.  dizziness or lightheadedness when getting up from a lying or sitting position
6.  drowsiness
7.  fainting
8.  fever
9.  hallucinations (seeing, hearing, or feeling things that are not there)
10.  headache
11.  nasal congestion (stuffy nose)
12.  nausea
13.  runny nose
14.  sneezing
15.  sore throat
16.  trouble in sleeping
17.  twitching, twisting, or other unusual body movements
18.  vomiting

【62】#### Less common

【63】1.  Absence of or decrease in body movement
2.  blood in urine
3.  chest pain
4.  chills
5.  confusion
6.  falling
7.  general feeling of discomfort or illness
8.  hyperactivity
9.  loss of balance control
10.  muscle pain
11.  troubled breathing

【64】#### Rare

【65】1.  Agitation
2.  bloody or cloudy urine
3.  burning of feet
4.  burning, prickling, or tingling sensations
5.  chest discomfort
6.  difficult or painful urination
7.  difficulty in thinking or concentrating
8.  frequent urge to urinate
9.  irritability
10.  joint pain, redness, or swelling
11.  low blood pressure
12.  muscle cramps
13.  neck pain
14.  stiffness

【66】Some side effects may occur that usually do not need medical attention. These side effects may go away during treatment as your body adjusts to the medicine. Also, your health care professional may be able to tell you about ways to prevent or reduce some of these side effects. Check with your health care professional if any of the following side effects continue or are bothersome or if you have any questions about them:

【67】#### More common

【68】1.  Constipation
2.  dryness of mouth
3.  excessive dreaming
4.  increased sweating

【69】#### Less common

【70】1.  Bleeding
2.  difficulty in sleeping
3.  excessive muscle tone
4.  fever
5.  heartburn
6.  gas
7.  muscle stiffness
8.  muscle tension or tightness
9.  trouble in holding or releasing urine

【71】After you stop using this medicine, it may still produce some side effects that need attention. During this period of time, check with your doctor immediately if you notice the following side effects:

【72】无关删除-1:<u>Other side effects not listed may also occur in some patients. If you notice any other effects, check with your healthcare professional.</u>

【73】无关删除-1:<u>Call your doctor for medical advice about side effects. You may report side effects to the FDA at 1-800-FDA-1088.</u>

【74】无关删除-1:<u>Portions of this document last updated: June 01, 2023</u>

【75】删除3:<u>无关删除-1:<u>Original article: https://www.mayoclinic.org/drugs-supplements/tolcapone-oral-route/description/drg-20068038</u></u>

title: Lincomycin (Injection Route)
text:
【0】Lincomycin (Injection Route)
Description and Brand Names
---------------------------

【1】Drug information provided by: Merative, Micromedex®

【2】### US Brand Name

【3】1.  Lincocin

【4】### Descriptions

【5】Lincomycin injection treats bacterial infections. It may be also given to patients who have an allergic reaction to penicillin antibiotics.

【6】Lincomycin belongs to the family of medicines called antibiotics. It works by killing bacteria or preventing their growth. However, this medicine will not work for colds, flu, or other virus infections.

【7】This medicine is to be given only by or under the direct supervision of your doctor.

【8】This product is available in the following dosage forms:

【9】*   Solution

【10】Before Using
------------

【11】In deciding to use a medicine, the risks of taking the medicine must be weighed against the good it will do. This is a decision you and your doctor will make. For this medicine, the following should be considered:

【12】### Allergies

【13】Tell your doctor if you have ever had any unusual or allergic reaction to this medicine or any other medicines. Also tell your health care professional if you have any other types of allergies, such as to foods, dyes, preservatives, or animals. For non-prescription products, read the label or package ingredients carefully.

【14】### Pediatric

【15】Appropriate studies have not been performed on the relationship of age to the effects of lincomycin injection in children younger than 1 month of age. Safety and efficacy have not been established.

【16】### Geriatric

【17】No information is available on the relationship of age to the effects of lincomycin injection in geriatric patients.

【18】### Breastfeeding

【19】There are no adequate studies in women for determining infant risk when using this medication during breastfeeding. Weigh the potential benefits against the potential risks before taking this medication while breastfeeding.

【20】### Drug Interactions

【21】Although certain medicines should not be used together at all, in other cases two different medicines may be used together even if an interaction might occur. In these cases, your doctor may want to change the dose, or other precautions may be necessary. When you are receiving this medicine, it is especially important that your healthcare professional know if you are taking any of the medicines listed below. The following interactions have been selected on the basis of their potential significance and are not necessarily all-inclusive.

【22】Using this medicine with any of the following medicines is usually not recommended, but may be required in some cases. If both medicines are prescribed together, your doctor may change the dose or how often you use one or both of the medicines.

【23】*   Ascorbic Acid
*   Cholera Vaccine, Live

【24】### Other Interactions

【25】Certain medicines should not be used at or around the time of eating food or eating certain types of food since interactions may occur. Using alcohol or tobacco with certain medicines may also cause interactions to occur. Discuss with your healthcare professional the use of your medicine with food, alcohol, or tobacco.

【26】### Other Medical Problems

【27】The presence of other medical problems may affect the use of this medicine. Make sure you tell your doctor if you have any other medical problems, especially:

【28】*   Allergy, history of or
*   Asthma, history of or
*   Diarrhea or
*   Stomach or bowel disease (eg, colitis), history of or—Use with caution. May make these conditions worse.

【29】*   Kidney disease, severe or
*   Liver disease, severe—Use with caution. The effects may be increased because of slower removal of the medicine from the body.

【30】Proper Use
----------

【31】A nurse or other trained health professional will give you or your child this medicine. This medicine is given as a shot into a muscle, vein or eye.

【32】Precautions
-----------

【33】It is very important that your doctor check your or your child's progress while you are receiving this medicine. This will allow your doctor to see if the medicine is working properly and to decide if you should continue to receive it. Blood and urine tests may be needed to check for unwanted effects.

【34】Do not use this medicine together with erythromycin (Ery-Tab®).

【35】This medicine may cause serious allergic reactions, including anaphylaxis, which can be life-threatening and require immediate medical attention. Call your doctor right away if you or your child have a rash, itching, hives, hoarseness, trouble breathing, trouble swallowing, or any swelling of your hands, face, or mouth after you receive this medicine.

【36】Lincomycin injection may cause diarrhea, and in some cases it can be severe. It may occur 2 months or more after you stop using this medicine. Do not take any medicine to treat diarrhea without first checking with your doctor. Diarrhea medicines may make the diarrhea worse or make it last longer. If you have any questions about this or if mild diarrhea continues or gets worse, check with your doctor.

【37】Side Effects
------------

【38】Along with its needed effects, a medicine may cause some unwanted effects. Although not all of these side effects may occur, if they do occur they may need medical attention.

【39】Check with your doctor or nurse immediately if any of the following side effects occur:

【40】#### Incidence not known

【41】1.  Abdominal or stomach pain or tenderness
2.  black, tarry stools
3.  blistering, peeling, or loosening of the skin
4.  blurred vision
5.  chills
6.  clay-colored stools
7.  confusion
8.  cough
9.  dark urine
10.  diarrhea
11.  difficulty with swallowing
12.  dizziness dizziness, faintness, or lightheadedness when getting up suddenly from a lying or sitting position
13.  fast heartbeat
14.  fever
15.  headache
16.  hives, itching, or rash
17.  joint or muscle pain
18.  loss of appetite
19.  lower back or side pain
20.  nausea
21.  painful or difficult urination
22.  pale skin
23.  puffiness or swelling of the eyelids or around the eyes, face, lips, or tongue
24.  red skin lesions, often with a purple center
25.  red, irritated eyes
26.  severe abdominal or stomach cramps and pain
27.  sore throat
28.  sores, ulcers, or white spots in the mouth or on the lips
29.  sweating
30.  tightness in the chest
31.  ulcers, sores, or white spots in the mouth
32.  unpleasant breath odor
33.  unusual bleeding or bruising
34.  unusual tiredness or weakness
35.  vomiting of blood
36.  watery and severe diarrhea, which may also be bloody
37.  yellow eyes or skin

【42】Some side effects may occur that usually do not need medical attention. These side effects may go away during treatment as your body adjusts to the medicine. Also, your health care professional may be able to tell you about ways to prevent or reduce some of these side effects. Check with your health care professional if any of the following side effects continue or are bothersome or if you have any questions about them:

【43】#### Incidence not known

【44】1.  Abdominal or stomach discomfort
2.  continuing ringing or buzzing or other unexplained noise in the ears
3.  feeling of constant movement of self or surroundings
4.  hearing loss
5.  pain, redness, or hard lumps at the injection site
6.  redness, swelling, or soreness of the tongue
7.  sensation of spinning
8.  sleepiness or unusual drowsiness

【45】无关删除-1:<u>Other side effects not listed may also occur in some patients. If you notice any other effects, check with your healthcare professional.</u>

【46】无关删除-1:<u>Call your doctor for medical advice about side effects. You may report side effects to the FDA at 1-800-FDA-1088.</u>

【47】无关删除-1:<u>Portions of this document last updated: Feb. 01, 2023</u>

title: Caffeine Citrate (Intravenous Route)
text:
【0】Caffeine Citrate (Intravenous Route)
Description and Brand Names
---------------------------

【1】Drug information provided by: Merative, Micromedex®

【2】### US Brand Name

【3】1.  Cafcit

【4】### Descriptions

【5】Caffeine citrate injection is used to treat short-term apnea of prematurity when premature babies (infants between 28 and 32 weeks gestational age) stop breathing. Apnea of prematurity is caused by the baby's breathing centers not being fully developed.

【6】This medicine is available with or without your doctor's prescription.

【7】This product is available in the following dosage forms:

【8】*   Solution

【9】Before Using
------------

【10】In deciding to use a medicine, the risks of taking the medicine must be weighed against the good it will do. This is a decision you and your doctor will make. For this medicine, the following should be considered:

【11】### Allergies

【12】Tell your doctor if you have ever had any unusual or allergic reaction to this medicine or any other medicines. Also tell your health care professional if you have any other types of allergies, such as to foods, dyes, preservatives, or animals. For non-prescription products, read the label or package ingredients carefully.

【13】### Pediatric

【14】Appropriate studies performed to date have not pediatric-specific problems that would limit the usefulness of caffeine citrate injection in premature babies.

【15】### Geriatric

【16】No information is available on the relationship of age to the effects of caffeine citrate injection in geriatric patients.

【17】### Breastfeeding

【18】Studies in women suggest that this medication poses minimal risk to the infant when used during breastfeeding.

【19】### Drug Interactions

【20】Although certain medicines should not be used together at all, in other cases two different medicines may be used together even if an interaction might occur. In these cases, your doctor may want to change the dose, or other precautions may be necessary. When you are receiving this medicine, it is especially important that your healthcare professional know if you are taking any of the medicines listed below. The following interactions have been selected on the basis of their potential significance and are not necessarily all-inclusive.

【21】Using this medicine with any of the following medicines is not recommended. Your doctor may decide not to treat you with this medication or change some of the other medicines you take.

【22】*   Riociguat
*   Viloxazine

【23】Using this medicine with any of the following medicines is usually not recommended, but may be required in some cases. If both medicines are prescribed together, your doctor may change the dose or how often you use one or both of the medicines.

【24】*   Capmatinib
*   Givosiran
*   Iobenguane I 131
*   Peginterferon Alfa-2b
*   Pixantrone
*   Ritlecitinib

【25】### Other Interactions

【26】Certain medicines should not be used at or around the time of eating food or eating certain types of food since interactions may occur. Using alcohol or tobacco with certain medicines may also cause interactions to occur. The following interactions have been selected on the basis of their potential significance and are not necessarily all-inclusive.

【27】Using this medicine with any of the following is usually not recommended, but may be unavoidable in some cases. If used together, your doctor may change the dose or how often you use this medicine, or give you special instructions about the use of food, alcohol, or tobacco.

【28】*   Tobacco

【29】### Other Medical Problems

【30】The presence of other medical problems may affect the use of this medicine. Make sure you tell your doctor if you have any other medical problems, especially:

【31】*   Anemia or
*   Central nervous system problems or
*   Heart or blood vessel problems or
*   Lung disease or breathing problems (eg, obstructive apnea) or
*   Sepsis (infection in the blood)—Should be ruled out or treated first before using this medicine.

【32】*   Hyperglycemia (high blood sugar) or
*   Hypoglycemia (high blood sugar) or
*   Necrotizing enterocolitis or
*   Seizures, history of—Use with caution. May make these conditions worse.

【33】*   Kidney disease or
*   Liver disease—Use with caution. The effects may be increased because of slower removal of caffeine oral solution from the body.

【34】Proper Use
----------

【35】A nurse or other trained health professional will give your baby this medicine in a hospital. This medicine is given through a needle placed in one of your baby's veins. The medicine must be injected slowly, so your baby's IV tube will need to stay in place for 10 to 30 minutes.

【36】Precautions
-----------

【37】Your baby's doctor will check your baby's progress closely while your baby is receiving this medicine. This will allow your doctor to see if the medicine is working properly and to decide if your baby should continue to receive it.

【38】Call your baby's doctor right away if your baby continues to have apnea.

【39】Tell your baby's doctor right away if your baby has one of the following symptoms: faster heartbeat, increased diaper wetting, restlessness, jitteriness, or shaking.

【40】Call your baby's doctor right away if your baby has the following symptoms: abdominal or stomach distension, vomiting, or bloody stools. These may be symptoms of a serious bowel or stomach problem.

【41】Do not take other medicines unless they have been discussed with your doctor. This includes prescription or nonprescription (over-the-counter \[OTC\]) medicines and herbal or vitamin supplements.

【42】Side Effects
------------

【43】Along with its needed effects, a medicine may cause some unwanted effects. Although not all of these side effects may occur, if they do occur they may need medical attention.

【44】Check with your doctor or nurse immediately if any of the following side effects occur:

【45】#### More common

【46】1.  Feeding intolerance

【47】#### Less common

【48】1.  Agitation
2.  black, tarry stools
3.  blood in the stools or urine
4.  bruising
5.  burning feeling or tenderness in the stomach
6.  chills
7.  coma
8.  confusion
9.  coughing or vomiting blood
10.  decreased urine output
11.  depression
12.  dizziness
13.  fainting
14.  fast heartbeat
15.  fever
16.  headache
17.  hostility
18.  indigestion
19.  irritability
20.  lethargy
21.  lightheadedness
22.  muscle twitching
23.  nausea
24.  persistent bleeding
25.  rapid, shallow breathing
26.  rapid weight gain
27.  rash
28.  seizures
29.  stomach upset
30.  swelling of the face, ankles, or hands
31.  trouble breathing
32.  unusual tiredness or weakness
33.  vomiting
34.  vomiting of blood or material that looks like coffee grounds

【49】Get emergency help immediately if any of the following symptoms of overdose occur:

【50】#### Symptoms of overdose

【51】1.  Irritability
2.  nervousness
3.  rapid heartbeat
4.  trouble sleeping

【52】Some side effects may occur that usually do not need medical attention. These side effects may go away during treatment as your body adjusts to the medicine. Also, your health care professional may be able to tell you about ways to prevent or reduce some of these side effects. Check with your health care professional if any of the following side effects continue or are bothersome or if you have any questions about them:

【53】#### Less common

【54】1.  Dry skin

【55】无关删除-1:<u>Other side effects not listed may also occur in some patients. If you notice any other effects, check with your healthcare professional.</u>

【56】无关删除-1:<u>Call your doctor for medical advice about side effects. You may report side effects to the FDA at 1-800-FDA-1088.</u>

title: Sulfamethoxazole And Trimethoprim (Oral Route)
text:
【0】Sulfamethoxazole And Trimethoprim (Oral Route)
Description and Brand Names
---------------------------

【1】Drug information provided by: Merative, Micromedex®

【2】### US Brand Name

【3】1.  Bactrim
2.  Bactrim DS
3.  Septra
4.  Septra DS
5.  SMZ-TMP Pediatric
6.  Sulfatrim
7.  Sulfatrim Pediatric

【4】### Canadian Brand Name

【5】1.  Apo-Sulfatrim
2.  Novo-Trimel
3.  Nu-Cotrimox
4.  Septa Pediatric
5.  Septra Pediatric Suspension

【6】### Descriptions

【7】Sulfamethoxazole and trimethoprim combination is used to treat infections including urinary tract infections, middle ear infections (otitis media), bronchitis, traveler's diarrhea, and shigellosis (bacillary dysentery). This medicine is also used to prevent or treat Pneumocystis jiroveci pneumonia or Pneumocystis carinii pneumonia (PCP), a very serious kind of pneumonia. This type of pneumonia occurs more commonly in patients whose immune systems are not working normally, including cancer patients, transplant patients, and patients with acquired immune deficiency syndrome (AIDS).

【8】Sulfamethoxazole and trimethoprim combination is an antibiotic. It works by eliminating the bacteria that cause many kinds of infections. This medicine will not work for colds, flu, or other virus infections.

【9】This medicine is available only with your doctor's prescription.

【10】This product is available in the following dosage forms:

【11】*   Tablet
*   Suspension

【12】Before Using
------------

【13】In deciding to use a medicine, the risks of taking the medicine must be weighed against the good it will do. This is a decision you and your doctor will make. For this medicine, the following should be considered:

【14】### Allergies

【15】Tell your doctor if you have ever had any unusual or allergic reaction to this medicine or any other medicines. Also tell your health care professional if you have any other types of allergies, such as to foods, dyes, preservatives, or animals. For non-prescription products, read the label or package ingredients carefully.

【16】### Pediatric

【17】Appropriate studies performed to date have not demonstrated pediatric-specific problems that would limit the usefulness of sulfamethoxazole and trimethoprim combination in children 2 months of age and older. Because of the toxicity of the combination of sulfamethoxazole and trimethoprim, use in infants younger than 2 months of age is not recommended.

【18】### Geriatric

【19】Appropriate studies performed to date have not demonstrated geriatric-specific problems that would limit the usefulness of sulfamethoxazole and trimethoprim combination in the elderly. However, elderly patients are more likely to have a folate deficiency, age-related kidney or liver problems, and may be more likely to experience unwanted side effects (eg, severe skin rash, increased potassium in the body, or problems with blood clotting or the immune system). There may be an adjustment in the dose for elderly patients receiving sulfamethoxazole and trimethoprim combination.

【20】### Breastfeeding

【21】Studies in women suggest that this medication poses minimal risk to the infant when used during breastfeeding.

【22】### Drug Interactions

【23】Although certain medicines should not be used together at all, in other cases two different medicines may be used together even if an interaction might occur. In these cases, your doctor may want to change the dose, or other precautions may be necessary. When you are taking this medicine, it is especially important that your healthcare professional know if you are taking any of the medicines listed below. The following interactions have been selected on the basis of their potential significance and are not necessarily all-inclusive.

【24】Using this medicine with any of the following medicines is not recommended. Your doctor may decide not to treat you with this medication or change some of the other medicines you take.

【25】*   Dofetilide
*   Levomethadyl
*   Methenamine

【26】Using this medicine with any of the following medicines is usually not recommended, but may be required in some cases. If both medicines are prescribed together, your doctor may change the dose or how often you use one or both of the medicines.

【27】*   Acecainide
*   Acenocoumarol
*   Ajmaline
*   Amiloride
*   Amiodarone
*   Amitriptyline
*   Amoxapine
*   Aprindine
*   Arsenic Trioxide
*   Astemizole
*   Azathioprine
*   Azilsartan
*   Azilsartan Medoxomil
*   Azimilide
*   Benazepril
*   Bretylium
*   Candesartan Cilexetil
*   Captopril
*   Ceritinib
*   Chloral Hydrate
*   Chloroquine
*   Chlorpromazine
*   Cholera Vaccine, Live
*   Clarithromycin
*   Desipramine
*   Dibenzepin
*   Digoxin
*   Disopyramide
*   Dolasetron
*   Doxepin
*   Dronedarone
*   Droperidol
*   Enalapril
*   Enalaprilat
*   Enflurane
*   Eplerenone
*   Eprosartan
*   Erythromycin
*   Flecainide
*   Fluconazole
*   Fluoxetine
*   Foscarnet
*   Fosinopril
*   Gemifloxacin
*   Halofantrine
*   Haloperidol
*   Halothane
*   Hydroquinidine
*   Ibutilide
*   Imipramine
*   Irbesartan
*   Isoflurane
*   Isradipine
*   Leucovorin
*   Lidoflazine
*   Lisinopril
*   Lorcainide
*   Losartan
*   Mefloquine
*   Mercaptopurine
*   Methotrexate
*   Moexipril
*   Nortriptyline
*   Octreotide
*   Olmesartan Medoxomil
*   Pentamidine
*   Perindopril
*   Pirmenol
*   Porfimer
*   Prajmaline
*   Probucol
*   Procainamide
*   Prochlorperazine
*   Propafenone
*   Pyrimethamine
*   Quinapril
*   Quinidine
*   Ramipril
*   Risperidone
*   Sapropterin
*   Sematilide
*   Sertindole
*   Sotalol
*   Spiramycin
*   Spironolactone
*   Sultopride
*   Tedisamil
*   Telithromycin
*   Telmisartan
*   Trandolapril
*   Triamterene
*   Trifluoperazine
*   Trimipramine
*   Valsartan
*   Warfarin
*   Zofenopril
*   Zotepine

【28】Using this medicine with any of the following medicines may cause an increased risk of certain side effects, but using both drugs may be the best treatment for you. If both medicines are prescribed together, your doctor may change the dose or how often you use one or both of the medicines.

【29】*   Acetohexamide
*   Amantadine
*   Aminolevulinic Acid
*   Anisindione
*   Didanosine
*   Fosphenytoin
*   Phenytoin
*   Repaglinide
*   Rifabutin
*   Rosiglitazone
*   Tolbutamide

【30】### Other Interactions

【31】Certain medicines should not be used at or around the time of eating food or eating certain types of food since interactions may occur. Using alcohol or tobacco with certain medicines may also cause interactions to occur. The following interactions have been selected on the basis of their potential significance and are not necessarily all-inclusive.

【32】Using this medicine with any of the following is usually not recommended, but may be unavoidable in some cases. If used together, your doctor may change the dose or how often you use this medicine, or give you special instructions about the use of food, alcohol, or tobacco.

【33】*   Ethanol

【34】### Other Medical Problems

【35】The presence of other medical problems may affect the use of this medicine. Make sure you tell your doctor if you have any other medical problems, especially:

【36】*   Alcohol abuse, history of or
*   Folate (vitamin B9) deficiency or
*   HIV or AIDS or
*   Kidney disease or
*   Liver disease or
*   Malabsorption syndrome (difficulty of absorbing food in the body) or
*   Malnutrition state (nutrition disorder) or
*   Slow acetylator—Use with caution. May have an increased chance of serious side effects.

【37】*   Anemia, megaloblastic (caused by low levels of folic acid in the body) or
*   Drug-induced thrombocytopenia (low platelets in the blood) after using this medicine or
*   Kidney disease, severe or
*   Liver disease, severe—Should not be used in patients with these conditions.

【38】*   Asthma or
*   Diabetes or
*   Hyperkalemia (high potassium in the blood) or
*   Hyponatremia (low sodium in the blood) or
*   Porphyria (enzyme problem) or
*   Severe allergies or
*   Thyroid problems—Use with caution. May make these conditions worse.

【39】*   Glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase (G6PD) deficiency (an enzyme problem)—May cause hemolytic anemia (blood disorder) in patients with this condition.

【40】*   Streptococcal infection (group A β-hemolytic)—Sulfonamides should not be used in patients with this condition.

【41】Proper Use
----------

【42】Take this medicine exactly as directed by your doctor. Do not take more of it, do not take it more often, and do not take it for a longer time than your doctor ordered. To do so may increase the chance of side effects.

【43】Sulfamethoxazole and trimethoprim combination is best taken with a full glass (8 ounces) of water. Several additional glasses of water should be taken every day, unless otherwise directed by your doctor. Drinking extra water will help to prevent some unwanted effects (eg, crystals in the urine).

【44】For patients taking the oral liquid, use a specially marked measuring spoon or other device to measure each dose accurately. The average household teaspoon may not hold the right amount of liquid.

【45】To help clear up your infection completely, keep using this medicine for the full time of treatment, even if you begin to feel better after a few days. If you stop taking this medicine too soon, your symptoms may return.

【46】### Dosing

【47】The dose of this medicine will be different for different patients. Follow your doctor's orders or the directions on the label. The following information includes only the average doses of this medicine. If your dose is different, do not change it unless your doctor tells you to do so.

【48】The amount of medicine that you take depends on the strength of the medicine. Also, the number of doses you take each day, the time allowed between doses, and the length of time you take the medicine depend on the medical problem for which you are using the medicine.

【49】*   For oral dosage forms (liquid or tablets):
    *   For treatment of bacterial infections:
        *   Adults—1 tablet (DS tablet) of 800 milligrams (mg) of sulfamethoxazole and 160 mg of trimethoprim, 2 tablets of 400 mg of sulfamethoxazole and 80 mg of trimethoprim, or 4 teaspoonfuls or 20 milliliters (mL) of oral liquid every 12 hours for 10 to 14 days. Your doctor may adjust this dose if needed.
        *   Children 2 months of age and older—Dose is based on body weight and must be determined by your doctor. The usual dose is 40 milligrams (mg) per kilogram of body weight of sulfamethoxazole and 8 milligrams (mg) per kilogram of body weight of trimethoprim, given in two divided doses every 12 hours for 10 days.
            *   Weighing 40 kilograms (kg)—4 teaspoonfuls (20 mL) of oral liquid or 2 tablets (or 1 DS tablet) 2 times a day for 10 days.
            *   Weighing 30 kg—3 teaspoonfuls (15 mL) of oral liquid or 1 ½ tablet 2 times a day for 10 days.
            *   Weighing 20 kg—2 teaspoonfuls (10 mL) of oral liquid or 1 tablet 2 times a day for 10 days.
            *   Weighing 10 kg—1 teaspoonful (5 mL) of oral liquid 2 times a day for 10 days.
        *   Children younger than 2 months of age—Use is not recommended.
    *   For treatment of bronchitis:
        *   Adults—1 tablet (DS tablet) of 800 milligrams (mg) of sulfamethoxazole and 160 mg of trimethoprim, 2 tablets of 400 mg of sulfamethoxazole and 80 mg of trimethoprim, or 4 teaspoonfuls or 20 milliliters (mL) of oral liquid every 12 hours for 14 days.
        *   Children 2 months of age and older—Use and dose must be determined by your doctor.
        *   Children younger than 2 months of age—Use is not recommended.
    *   For treatment of Pneumocystis jiroveci pneumonia or Pneumocystis carinii pneumonia (PCP):
        *   Adults and children 2 months of age and older—Dose is based on body weight and must be determined by your doctor. The usual dose is 75 to 100 milligrams (mg) per kilogram of body weight of sulfamethoxazole and 15 to 20 milligrams (mg) per kilogram of body weight of trimethoprim each day, given in equally divided doses every 6 hours for 14 to 21 days.
            *   Weighing 80 kilograms (kg)—10 teaspoonfuls (50 milliliters (mL)) or 5 tablets (or 2 ½ DS tablets) 4 times a day for 14 to 21 days.
            *   Weighing 64 kg—8 teaspoonfuls (40 mL) or 4 tablets (or 2 DS tablets) 4 times a day for 14 to 21 days.
            *   Weighing 48 kg—6 teaspoonfuls (30 mL) or 3 tablets (or 1 ½ DS tablets) 4 times a day for 14 to 21 days.
            *   Weighing 40 kg—5 teaspoonfuls (25 mL) or 2 ½ tablets 4 times a day for 14 to 21 days.
            *   Weighing 32 kg—4 teaspoonfuls (20 mL) or 2 tablets (or 1 DS tablet) 4 times a day for 14 to 21 days.
            *   Weighing 24 kg—3 teaspoonfuls (15 mL) or 1 ½ tablets 4 times a day for 14 to 21 days.
            *   Weighing 16 kg—2 teaspoonfuls (10 mL) or 1 tablet 4 times a day for 14 to 21 days.
            *   Weighing 8 kg—1 teaspoonful (5 mL) 4 times a day for 14 to 21 days.
        *   Children younger than 2 months of age—Use is not recommended.
    *   For prevention of Pneumocystis jiroveci pneumonia or Pneumocystis carinii pneumonia (PCP):
        *   Adults—800 milligrams (mg) of sulfamethoxazole and 160 mg of trimethoprim once a day.
        *   Children 2 months of age and older—Dose is based on body size and must be determined by your doctor. The usual dose is 750 mg of sulfamethoxazole and 150 mg of trimethoprim per square meter (m\[2\]) of body surface each day. This is given in equally divided doses two times a day for 3 days a week on consecutive days (eg, Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday). However, the dose is usually not more than 1600 mg of sulfamethoxazole and 320 mg of trimethoprim per day.
        *   Children younger than 2 months of age—Use is not recommended.
    *   For treatment of traveler's diarrhea:
        *   Adults—1 tablet (DS tablet) of 800 milligrams (mg) of sulfamethoxazole and 160 mg of trimethoprim, 2 tablets of 400 mg of sulfamethoxazole and 80 mg of trimethoprim, or 4 teaspoonfuls or 20 milliliters (mL) of oral liquid every 12 hours for 5 days.
        *   Children 2 months of age and older—Use and dose must be determined by your doctor.
        *   Children younger than 2 months of age—Use is not recommended.

【50】### Missed Dose

【51】If you miss a dose of this medicine, take it as soon as possible. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and go back to your regular dosing schedule. Do not double doses.

【52】### Storage

【53】Store the medicine in a closed container at room temperature, away from heat, moisture, and direct light. Keep from freezing.

【54】Keep out of the reach of children.

【55】Do not keep outdated medicine or medicine no longer needed.

【56】Ask your healthcare professional how you should dispose of any medicine you do not use.

【57】Precautions
-----------

【58】It is very important that your doctor check the progress of you or your child at regular visits to make sure that this medicine is working properly. Blood and urine tests may be needed to check for unwanted effects.

【59】Using this medicine while you are pregnant can harm your unborn baby. Use an effective form of birth control to keep from getting pregnant. If you think you have become pregnant while using the medicine, tell your doctor right away.

【60】This medicine may cause serious skin reactions, including Stevens-Johnson syndrome, toxic epidermal necrolysis, drug reaction with eosinophilia and systemic symptoms (DRESS), acute generalized exanthematous pustulosis (AGEP), or acute febrile neutrophilic dermatosis (AFND). Check with your doctor if you have a skin rash, blistering, peeling, loosening of the skin, chills, cough, diarrhea, itching, joint or muscle pain, red irritated eyes, red skin lesions, often with a purple center, sore throat, sores, ulcers, white spots in the mouth or on the lips, black, tarry stools, chest pain, or painful or difficult urination.

【61】Check with your doctor right away if you have dark urine, clay-colored stools, stomach pain, or yellow eyes or skin. These may be symptoms of a serious liver problem.

【62】This medicine, especially if you are receiving high doses or for a long period of time, may lower the number of platelets in your body, which are necessary for proper blood clotting. Because of this, you may bleed or get infections more easily. Talk with your doctor if you have black, tarry stools, bleeding gums, blood in urine or stools, pinpoint red spots on the skin, unusual bleeding or bruising.

【63】This medicine may cause diarrhea, and in some cases it can be severe. It may occur 2 months or more after you stop taking this medicine. Do not take any medicine to treat diarrhea without first checking with your doctor. If you have any questions or if mild diarrhea continues or gets worse, check with your doctor.

【64】Check with your doctor right away if you or your child have stomach cramps, bloating, watery and severe diarrhea, which may also be bloody, nausea or vomiting, or unusual tiredness or weakness. These may be symptoms of a serious intestinal infection.

【65】This medicine may cause serious allergic reactions, including anaphylaxis, which can be life-threatening and require immediate medical attention. Check with your doctor right away if you or your child have a rash, itching, swelling of the face, tongue, and throat, trouble breathing, or chest pain after you use the medicine.

【66】This medicine may cause electrolyte problems, including high potassium in the blood (hyperkalemia) and low sodium in the blood (hyponatremia). Tell your doctor right away if you have confusion, weakness, muscle twitching, an irregular heartbeat, numbness or tingling in the hands, feet, or lips, or trouble breathing.

【67】This medicine may cause hypoglycemia (low blood sugar) in some patients. Check with your doctor if you have anxiety, behavior change similar to being drunk, blurred vision, cold sweats, confusion, cool pale skin, difficulty with concentrating, drowsiness, excessive hunger, headache, nausea, nervousness, rapid heartbeat, shakiness, or unusual tiredness or weakness.

【68】Before you have any medical tests, tell the medical doctor in charge that you or your child are taking this medicine. The results of some tests may be affected by this medicine.

【69】Patients receiving anticonvulsant treatment (medicines to prevent seizures) may be at risk for a folate (vitamin B9) deficiency, which may increase the risk for side effects. Talk with your doctor if you have concerns about this.

【70】Do not use this medicine if you are also using dofetilide (Tikosyn®).

【71】Do not use this medicine for Pneumocystis jiroveci pneumonia (PCP) if you are also using leucovorin. Using these medicines together may cause these medicines to not work as well for you.

【72】Do not take other medicines unless they have been discussed with your doctor. This includes leucovorin, other prescription or nonprescription (over-the-counter \[OTC\]) medicines and herbal or vitamin supplements.

【73】Side Effects
------------

【74】Along with its needed effects, a medicine may cause some unwanted effects. Although not all of these side effects may occur, if they do occur they may need medical attention.

【75】Check with your doctor immediately if any of the following side effects occur:

【76】#### More common

【77】1.  Black, tarry stools
2.  blistering, peeling, or loosening of the skin
3.  changes in skin color
4.  chest pain or tightness
5.  chills
6.  clay-colored stools
7.  cough or hoarseness
8.  dark urine
9.  diarrhea
10.  dizziness
11.  fever
12.  general feeling of tiredness or weakness
13.  headache
14.  itching, skin rash
15.  joint or muscle pain
16.  light-colored stools
17.  loss of appetite
18.  lower back or side pain
19.  nausea
20.  pain, tenderness, or swelling of the foot or leg
21.  painful or difficult urination
22.  pale skin
23.  red skin lesions, often with a purple center
24.  red, irritated eyes
25.  sore throat
26.  sores, ulcers, or white spots in the mouth or on the lips
27.  stomach pain
28.  swollen or painful glands
29.  trouble breathing
30.  unpleasant breath odor
31.  unusual bleeding or bruising
32.  vomiting of blood
33.  yellow eyes or skin

【78】#### Incidence not known

【79】1.  Back, leg, or stomach pains
2.  bleeding gums
3.  blindness or vision changes
4.  bloating
5.  blood in the urine or stools
6.  bluish-colored lips, fingernails, or palms
7.  burning, crawling, itching, numbness, painful, prickling, "pins and needles", or tingling feelings
8.  burning of the face or mouth
9.  cloudy urine
10.  clumsiness or unsteadiness
11.  confusion
12.  constipation
13.  continuing ringing or buzzing or other unexplained noise in the ears
14.  cracks in the skin
15.  decreased frequency or amount of urine
16.  difficulty with swallowing
17.  fainting spells
18.  fast, pounding, or irregular heartbeat or pulse
19.  general body swelling
20.  general feeling of discomfort or illness
21.  hair loss
22.  hearing loss
23.  hives
24.  increased thirst
25.  indigestion
26.  large, flat, blue, or purplish patches in the skin
27.  large, hive-like swelling on the face, eyelids, lips, tongue, throat, hands, legs, feet, or sex organs
28.  loss of heat from the body
29.  muscle or joint pain
30.  nosebleeds
31.  not able to pass urine
32.  numbness or tingling in the hands, feet, or lips
33.  pain or burning while urinating
34.  pinpoint red spots on the skin
35.  puffiness or swelling of the eyelids or around the eyes, face, lips, or tongue
36.  raised red swellings on the skin, the buttocks, legs, or ankles
37.  redness of the white part of the eyes
38.  redness, swelling, or soreness of the tongue
39.  seizures
40.  soreness of the muscles
41.  stiff neck or back
42.  stomach tenderness
43.  swelling of the face, hands, legs, and feet
44.  unsteadiness, trembling, or other problems with muscle control or coordination
45.  weakness in the hands or feet
46.  weakness or heaviness of the legs
47.  weight gain or loss

【80】Some side effects may occur that usually do not need medical attention. These side effects may go away during treatment as your body adjusts to the medicine. Also, your health care professional may be able to tell you about ways to prevent or reduce some of these side effects. Check with your health care professional if any of the following side effects continue or are bothersome or if you have any questions about them:

【81】#### More common

【82】1.  Passing of gas

【83】#### Incidence not known

【84】1.  Discouragement
2.  feeling of constant movement of self or surroundings
3.  feeling sad or empty
4.  increased sensitivity of the skin to sunlight
5.  lack of feeling or emotion
6.  loss of interest or pleasure
7.  muscle pain, stiffness, cramps, or spasms
8.  nervousness
9.  redness or other discoloration of the skin
10.  seeing, hearing, or feeling things that are not there
11.  sensation of spinning
12.  severe sunburn
13.  trouble concentrating
14.  trouble sleeping
15.  uncaring
16.  weight loss

【85】无关删除-1:<u>Other side effects not listed may also occur in some patients. If you notice any other effects, check with your healthcare professional.</u>

【86】无关删除-1:<u>Call your doctor for medical advice about side effects. You may report side effects to the FDA at 1-800-FDA-1088.</u>

title: Ivabradine (Oral Route)
text:
【0】Ivabradine (Oral Route)
Description and Brand Names
---------------------------

【1】Drug information provided by: Merative, Micromedex®

【2】### US Brand Name

【3】1.  Corlanor

【4】### Descriptions

【5】Ivabradine is used to treat adults who have chronic heart failure to reduce their risk of hospitalization for worsening heart failure. It is also used to treat heart failure in children 6 months of age and older who have stable heart failure, with symptoms, caused by an enlarged heart (dilated cardiomyopathy).

【6】This medicine is available only with your doctor's prescription.

【7】This product is available in the following dosage forms:

【8】*   Solution
*   Tablet

【9】Before Using
------------

【10】In deciding to use a medicine, the risks of taking the medicine must be weighed against the good it will do. This is a decision you and your doctor will make. For this medicine, the following should be considered:

【11】### Allergies

【12】Tell your doctor if you have ever had any unusual or allergic reaction to this medicine or any other medicines. Also tell your health care professional if you have any other types of allergies, such as to foods, dyes, preservatives, or animals. For non-prescription products, read the label or package ingredients carefully.

【13】### Pediatric

【14】Appropriate studies have not been performed on the relationship of age to the effects of ivabradine in children younger than 6 months of age. Safety and efficacy have not been established.

【15】### Geriatric

【16】Appropriate studies performed to date have not demonstrated geriatric-specific problems that would limit the usefulness of ivabradine in the elderly.

【17】### Breastfeeding

【18】There are no adequate studies in women for determining infant risk when using this medication during breastfeeding. Weigh the potential benefits against the potential risks before taking this medication while breastfeeding.

【19】### Drug Interactions

【20】Although certain medicines should not be used together at all, in other cases two different medicines may be used together even if an interaction might occur. In these cases, your doctor may want to change the dose, or other precautions may be necessary. When you are taking this medicine, it is especially important that your healthcare professional know if you are taking any of the medicines listed below. The following interactions have been selected on the basis of their potential significance and are not necessarily all-inclusive.

【21】Using this medicine with any of the following medicines is not recommended. Your doctor may decide not to treat you with this medication or change some of the other medicines you take.

【22】*   Bepridil
*   Boceprevir
*   Cisapride
*   Clarithromycin

*   Conivaptan
*   Darunavir
*   Dronedarone
*   Fluconazole

*   Thioridazine

*   Ziprasidone

【23】Using this medicine with any of the following medicines is usually not recommended, but may be required in some cases. If both medicines are prescribed together, your doctor may change the dose or how often you use one or both of the medicines.

【25】### Other Interactions

【26】Certain medicines should not be used at or around the time of eating food or eating certain types of food since interactions may occur. Using alcohol or tobacco with certain medicines may also cause interactions to occur. The following interactions have been selected on the basis of their potential significance and are not necessarily all-inclusive.

【27】### Other Medical Problems

【28】The presence of other medical problems may affect the use of this medicine. Make sure you tell your doctor if you have any other medical problems, especially:

【29】*   Atrial fibrillation or
*   Heart rhythm problems (eg, heart block, sinus arrest)—Use with caution. May make these conditions worse.

【30】*   Bradycardia (slow heartbeat) or
*   Heart failure, decompensated or
*   Heart rhythm problem (eg, AV block, sinoatrial block, sick sinus syndrome), without a pacemaker or
*   Hypotension (very low blood pressure) or
*   Liver disease, severe or
*   Pacemaker dependence—Should not be used in patients with these conditions.

【31】Proper Use
----------

【32】Use this medicine exactly as directed by your doctor. Do not use more of it, do not use it more often, and do not use it for a longer time than your doctor ordered.

【33】This medicine comes with a Medication Guide and patient instructions. Read and follow these instructions carefully. Ask your doctor if you have any questions.

【34】Take this medicine with food.

【35】If you cannot swallow the tablet, you may use the oral liquid. To use:

【36】*   Empty the contents of the ampule into a medication cup. Keep the ampule in its unopened foil pouch until you are ready to use it.
*   Measure the liquid with a marked oral syringe to get your dose.
*   Place the tip of the oral syringe into your or your child’s mouth and towards the cheek. Then slowly push down on the plunger until the oral syringe is empty.
*   Do not save or reuse any leftover oral liquid in the cup or oral syringe.

【37】Do not eat grapefruit or drink grapefruit juice while you are using this medicine. Grapefruit and grapefruit juice may change the amount of this medicine that is absorbed in the body.

【38】### Dosing

【39】The dose of this medicine will be different for different patients. Follow your doctor's orders or the directions on the label. The following information includes only the average doses of this medicine. If your dose is different, do not change it unless your doctor tells you to do so.

【40】The amount of medicine that you take depends on the strength of the medicine. Also, the number of doses you take each day, the time allowed between doses, and the length of time you take the medicine depend on the medical problem for which you are using the medicine.

【41】*   For heart failure:

【42】    *   For oral dosage form (solution):
        *   Adults—At first, 5 milligrams (mg) 2 times a day. Your doctor may adjust your dose as needed and tolerated. However, the dose is usually not more than 7.5 mg 2 times a day.
        *   Children 6 months of age and older weighing less than 40 kilograms (kg)—Dose is based on body weight and must be determined by your doctor. At first, 0.05 milligram per kilogram (mg/kg) of body weight. Your doctor may adjust your dose as needed and tolerated. However, the dose is usually not more than 7.5 mg 2 times a day.
        *   Children younger than 6 months of age—Use and dose must be determined by your doctor.

【43】    *   For oral dosage form (tablets):
        *   Adults—At first, 5 milligrams (mg) 2 times a day. Your doctor may adjust your dose as needed and tolerated. However, the dose is usually not more than 7.5 mg 2 times a day.
        *   Children weighing 40 kilograms (kg) or more—At first, 2.5 milligrams (mg) 2 times a day. Your doctor may adjust your dose as needed and tolerated. However, the dose is usually not more than 7.5 mg 2 times a day.
        *   Children weighing less than 40 kg—Use and dose must be determined by your doctor.

【44】### Missed Dose

【45】If you miss a dose of this medicine, skip the missed dose and go back to your regular dosing schedule. Do not double doses.

【46】### Storage

【47】Store the medicine in a closed container at room temperature, away from heat, moisture, and direct light. Keep from freezing.

【48】Keep out of the reach of children.

【49】Do not keep outdated medicine or medicine no longer needed.

【50】Ask your healthcare professional how you should dispose of any medicine you do not use.

【51】Throw away any unused oral liquid.

【52】Precautions
-----------

【53】It is very important that your doctor check your progress at regular visits. This will allow your doctor to see if the medicine is working properly and to check for unwanted effects.

【54】Using this medicine while you are pregnant can harm your unborn baby. Use an effective form of birth control to keep from getting pregnant. If you think you have become pregnant while using this medicine, tell your doctor right away.

【55】Do not use this medicine if you are also using clarithromycin (Biaxin®), itraconazole (Sporanox®), ketoconazole (Nizoral®), nefazodone (Serzone®), nelfinavir (Viracept®), or telithromycin (Ketek®). Using these medicines together may cause serious unwanted effects.

【56】This medicine may increase your risk for heart rhythm problems, including atrial fibrillation and bradycardia. Check with your doctor right away if you have fast, slow, or irregular heartbeat, dizziness, fainting, or trouble breathing while using this medicine.

【57】This medicine may cause temporary visual brightness, usually caused by sudden changes in light (luminous phenomena or phosphenes). This may happen within the first 2 months of treatment with this medicine. Use caution when driving or using machines where sudden changes in light can happen, especially when driving at night.

【58】Do not take other medicines unless thy have been discussed with your doctor. This includes prescription or nonprescription (over-the-counter \[OTC\]) medicines and herbal (eg, St. John's wort) or vitamin supplements.

【59】Side Effects
------------

【60】Along with its needed effects, a medicine may cause some unwanted effects. Although not all of these side effects may occur, if they do occur they may need medical attention.

【61】Check with your doctor immediately if any of the following side effects occur:

【62】#### More common

【63】1.  Blurred vision
2.  chest pain or discomfort
3.  fast or irregular heartbeat
4.  headache
5.  lightheadedness, dizziness, or fainting
6.  nervousness
7.  pounding in the ears
8.  slow or irregular heartbeat
9.  unusual tiredness

【64】#### Incidence not known

【65】1.  Confusion
2.  dizziness, faintness, or lightheadedness when getting up suddenly from a lying or sitting position
3.  hives or welts, itching, or skin rash
4.  large, hive-like swelling on the face, eyelids, lips, tongue, throat, hands, legs, feet, or genitals
5.  sweating

【66】Some side effects may occur that usually do not need medical attention. These side effects may go away during treatment as your body adjusts to the medicine. Also, your health care professional may be able to tell you about ways to prevent or reduce some of these side effects. Check with your health care professional if any of the following side effects continue or are bothersome or if you have any questions about them:

【67】#### Less common

【68】1.  Seeing flashes of light

【69】#### Incidence not known

【70】1.  Double vision
2.  feeling of constant movement of self or surroundings
3.  flushing or redness of the skin
4.  seeing double
5.  sensation of spinning
6.  trouble seeing
7.  unusually warm skin

【71】无关删除-1:<u>Other side effects not listed may also occur in some patients. If you notice any other effects, check with your healthcare professional.</u>

【72】无关删除-1:<u>Call your doctor for medical advice about side effects. You may report side effects to the FDA at 1-800-FDA-1088.</u>

【73】无关删除-1:<u>Portions of this document last updated: Aug. 01, 2023</u>

【74】删除3:<u>无关删除-1:<u>Original article: https://www.mayoclinic.org/drugs-supplements/ivabradine-oral-route/description/drg-20138533</u></u>

title: Effect of Cardiac Rehabilitation Dose on Mortality and Morbidity: A Systematic Review and Meta-regression Analysis
text:
【0】Effect of Cardiac Rehabilitation Dose on Mortality and Morbidity: A Systematic Review and Meta-regression Analysis
Abstract
--------

【1】### Objective

【2】To ascertain the effect of cardiac rehabilitation (CR) dose (ie, duration × frequency/wk; categorized as low \[<12 sessions\], medium \[12-35 sessions\], or high \[≥36 sessions\]) on mortality and morbidity.

【3】### Methods

【4】The Cochrane, CINAHL, EMBASE, PsycINFO, and MEDLINE databases were systematically searched from inception through November 30, 2015. Inclusion criteria included randomized or nonrandomized studies with a minimum CR dose of 4 or higher and presence of a control/comparison group. Citations were considered for inclusion, and data were extracted in included studies independently by 2 investigators. Studies were pooled using random-effects meta-analysis and meta-regression where warranted (covariates included study quality, country, publication year, and diagnosis).

【5】### Results

【6】Of 4630 unique citations, 33 trials were included comparing CR to usual care (ie, no dose). In meta-regression, greater dose was significantly related to lower all-cause mortality (high: −0.77; SE, 0.22; _P_ <.001; medium: −0.80; SE, 0.21; _P_ <.001) when compared with low dose. With regard to morbidity, meta-analysis revealed that dose was significantly associated with fewer percutaneous coronary interventions (high: relative risk, 0.65; 95% CI, 0.50-0.84; medium/low: relative risk, 1.04; 95% CI, 0.74-1.48; between subgroup difference _P_ \=.03). This reduction was also significant in meta-regression (high vs medium/low: −0.73; SE, 0.20; _P_ <.001). Publication bias was not evident. No dose-response association was found for cardiovascular mortality, all-cause hospitalization, coronary artery bypass graft surgery, or myocardial infarction.

【7】### Conclusion

【8】A minimum of 36 CR sessions may be needed to reduce percutaneous coronary interventions. Future studies should examine the effect of actual dose of CR, and trials are needed comparing different doses.

【9】### PROSPERO Registration

【10】CRD42016036029 .

【11】#### Abbreviations and Acronyms:

【12】CABG ( coronary artery bypass graft ), CCR ( comprehensive cardiac rehabilitation ), CR ( cardiac rehabilitation ), CV ( cardiovascular ), CVD ( cardiovascular disease ), HF ( heart failure ), MI ( myocardial infarction ), PCI ( percutaneous coronary intervention )

title: Head and neck cancers
text:
【0】Overview
--------

【1】Head and neck cancers are a broad category of cancers that occur in the head and neck region.

【2】Head and neck cancer treatment depends on the type, location and size of your cancer. Treatment for head and neck cancers often involves surgery, radiation therapy and chemotherapy. Treatments may be combined.

【3】After treatment, recovery from head and neck cancers may involve working with rehabilitation specialists and other experts to cope with side effects, such as hearing loss, difficulty eating, dental problems, thyroid issues, difficulty breathing or difficulty speaking.

【4】删除1:<u>By Mayo Clinic Staff</u>

title: Posaconazole (Oral Route)
text:
【0】Posaconazole (Oral Route)
Description and Brand Names
---------------------------

【1】Drug information provided by: Merative, Micromedex®

【2】### US Brand Name

【3】1.  Noxafil
2.  Noxafil PowderMix

【4】### Descriptions

【5】Posaconazole delayed-release tablets, oral suspension, and delayed-release oral suspension are used to prevent certain fungus (yeast) infections (eg, invasive Aspergillus or Candida infections) in patients who have a weakened immune system (eg, hematopoietic stem cell transplant or HSCT recipients, or patients with blood cancers).

【6】Posaconazole delayed-release tablets is also used to treat invasive aspergillosis.

【7】Posaconazole oral suspension is also used to treat a fungus infection of the mouth or throat called oral thrush (candidiasis). Posaconazole oral suspension may be used as an initial treatment or after treatment with other antifungal medicines (eg, itraconazole or fluconazole) have failed.

【8】This medicine is available only with your doctor's prescription.

【9】This product is available in the following dosage forms:

【10】*   Tablet, Delayed Release
*   Suspension
*   Powder for Suspension, Extended Release

【11】Before Using
------------

【12】In deciding to use a medicine, the risks of taking the medicine must be weighed against the good it will do. This is a decision you and your doctor will make. For this medicine, the following should be considered:

【13】### Allergies

【14】Tell your doctor if you have ever had any unusual or allergic reaction to this medicine or any other medicines. Also tell your health care professional if you have any other types of allergies, such as to foods, dyes, preservatives, or animals. For non-prescription products, read the label or package ingredients carefully.

【15】### Pediatric

【16】Appropriate studies performed to date have not demonstrated pediatric-specific problems that would limit the usefulness of posaconazole delayed-release tablets, oral suspension, and delayed-release oral suspension in children 2 years of age and older to prevent fungus infections. However, safety and efficacy have not been established in children younger than 2 years of age. Use of delayed-release oral suspension in children weighing more than 40 kilograms (kg) is not recommended.

【17】Appropriate studies performed to date have not demonstrated pediatric-specific problems that would limit the usefulness of posaconazole delayed-release tablets in children 13 years of age and older to treat invasive aspergillosis. Safety and efficacy have been established.

【18】Appropriate studies performed to date have not demonstrated pediatric-specific problems that would limit the usefulness of posaconazole oral suspension in children 13 years of age and older to treat oral thrush (candidiasis). Safety and efficacy have been established.

【19】### Geriatric

【20】Appropriate studies performed to date have not demonstrated geriatric-specific problems that would limit the usefulness of posaconazole in the elderly.

【21】### Breastfeeding

【22】There are no adequate studies in women for determining infant risk when using this medication during breastfeeding. Weigh the potential benefits against the potential risks before taking this medication while breastfeeding.

【23】### Drug Interactions

【24】Although certain medicines should not be used together at all, in other cases two different medicines may be used together even if an interaction might occur. In these cases, your doctor may want to change the dose, or other precautions may be necessary. When you are taking this medicine, it is especially important that your healthcare professional know if you are taking any of the medicines listed below. The following interactions have been selected on the basis of their potential significance and are not necessarily all-inclusive.
